result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin J Rohr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is ordered to submit a DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin J Rohr

records.addlTxt:
Zoom appearances.
Defendant in custody in Manitowoc County Jail.
The State moves to delete the repeater enhancer on count 3. Motion granted.
NO CONTEST plea entered to the amended charge in count 3, possess THC.  Convicted.
The State moves to dismiss and read in counts 1 and 2.  Motion granted.
The Court imposes a $150.00 fine plus costs, total of $783.75, to be paid by 10-25-22 or 16 days county jail for failure to pay.
DNA sample ordered.
Minutes.
Plea date on August 25, 2022 at 09:30 am.

11:01 a.m.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing; 6/27/22 inducement.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed. Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea(s) entered.  Jury calendar.
Offer deadline:  9/2/22, 8:30 a.m.
Further proceedings scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 28, 2022 at 10:30 am.

2:13 pm - Prosecuting attorney Jill L. Vendetti appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Justin J Rohr not in court.  Attorney Larry J. Lloyd appeared by video for Justin J Rohr.  State requests warrant.  Court authorizes warrant.

At 3:24 pm, the defendant showed up at the Clerk's office and was told to log into Branch 3 on zoom, since there was still zoom court being conducted.  The Court advises the defendant that his case was called over an hour after his scheduled time and he still did not appear.  The Court will NOT issue the warrant in this matter as previously authorized.  The defendant is to contact Attorney Lloyd to get this matter reset.  Defendant states that he has Atty. Lloyd's contact information.

2:05 pm - Prosecuting attorney Jordan W. Feest in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Justin J Rohr in court.  Attorney Larry J. Lloyd appeared by video for Justin J Rohr. Defendant demands a preliminary hearing. Preliminary hearing is set for 07-06-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 3.
Preliminary hearing on July 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Initial appearance on June 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

2:45 pm - Prosecuting attorney Gail Ann Prost in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Justin Rohr appearing by video, in custody at Manitowoc County Jail.  Attorney Nathan Heim appearing in person for defendant.   More time needed to appoint counsel in this matter.  Initial appearance is adjourned to 06-20-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 3.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of possess methamphetamine, possess THC and possess fentanyl.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 05-23-22 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $3,000.00 recognizance bond.  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.
